update.description:
NOTE: The custom snap values PR (#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/493) needs to be merged before this one can be.

Ready for review

Adds all hotkeys seen at http://gazebosim.org/hotkeys under the `Manipulating Models` category except for `Snap when inserting` and `Snap models together`

Specifically:

* Adds key presses for switching between selection (ESC), translation (t), rotation (r), scaling (s)

* Adds 1m snapping for translation when holding CTRL

* Adds 45 degree snapping for rotation when holding CTRL

* Adds 0.5 scale snapping when scaling when holding CTRL (support was added even though scaling is not yet a feature)

* Constrains along the x, y, or z axis when holding those respective keys while dragging

* Transforming via world frame when holding Shift
update.title: Add keybindings

content.html: I can't reproduce the issue anymore

content.html: Works great for me!

content.raw: :thumbsup:
:thumbsup:
:thumbsup:

The press position needs to be set on a translation button press or release as well as a mouse click press.  This is so that the motion of dragging an object stays consistent and isn’t jumpy. `Start` is needed on both a button press and release due to the `Start` function updating the start pose and scale of the node currently being operated.  If the `Start` is not in the release button code, the object will teleport back to where it began on a button press.
content.html: The press position needs to be set on a translation button press or release as well as a mouse click press. This is so that the motion of dragging an object stays consistent and isn’t jumpy. Start is needed on both a button press and release due to the Start function updating the start pose and scale of the node currently being operated. If the Start is not in the release button code, the object will teleport back to where it began on a button press.

content.raw: I just added multi axis selection \(holding x, y, and/or z down at the same time\).  Let me know what you think @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} , if you don’t think this addition to be useful/adequate, we can easily revert back to Gazebo classic behavior.
content.html: I just added multi axis selection (holding x, y, and/or z down at the same time). Let me know what you think @Louise Poubel , if you don’t think this addition to be useful/adequate, we can easily revert back to Gazebo classic behavior.

content.raw:
Thanks for catching this, it was a tricky bug and at first seemed like a trivial problem but actually was pretty important to fix. Everything ~should~ be good now…

The case was when the mouse was released while the translating hotkeys are still being held. I was making the assumption that one should release the hotkeys first and then release the mouse, so doing it the other way around put the system into a state it shouldn’t have been in.
content.html:
Thanks for catching this, it was a tricky bug and at first seemed like a trivial problem but actually was pretty important to fix. Everything ~should~ be good now…

The case was when the mouse was released while the translating hotkeys are still being held. I was making the assumption that one should release the hotkeys first and then release the mouse, so doing it the other way around put the system into a state it shouldn’t have been in.

content.raw:
Style nitpicks:

* use `this->`
* Remove the `Get` from the function name
content.html:
Style nitpicks:

  • use this->
  • Remove the Get from the function name

content.raw: Just a suggestion for the future, ign-math has these handy values predefined, i.e. `math::Vector3d::UnitX`
content.html: Just a suggestion for the future, ign-math has these handy values predefined, i.e. math::Vector3d::UnitX

content.raw: It would be nice to write unit tests for these functions, but I think we don't have any boilerplate for unit testing plugins yet, so I'm ok skipping it for now.
content.html: It would be nice to write unit tests for these functions, but I think we don't have any boilerplate for unit testing plugins yet, so I'm ok skipping it for now.

content.raw: Do we need to `Start` both on press and release? Also I think we shouldn't be setting the press pos on a release, right?
content.html: Do we need to Start both on press and release? Also I think we shouldn't be setting the press pos on a release, right?

content.raw:
I noticed that if I use the sequential hotkeys, the next time I use the tool there's a jump when I start dragging the arrow:

![hotkeys_issue.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1883291125-hotkeys_issue.gif)

I think some variable needs to be reset.
content.html:

Adds all hotkeys seen at http://gazebosim.org/hotkeys under the `Manipulating Models` category except for `Snap when inserting` and `Snap models together`

Specifically:

* Adds key presses for switching between selection (ESC), translation (t), rotation (r), scaling (s)

* Adds 1m snapping for translation when holding CTRL

* Adds 45 degree snapping for rotation when holding CTRL

* Adds 0.5 scale snapping when scaling when holding CTRL (support was added even though scaling is not yet a feature)

* Constrains along the x, y, or z axis when holding those respective keys while dragging

* Transforming via world frame when holding Shift

content.raw: Just for completeness, you could also set the event type: `this->dataPtr->keyEvent.SetType(KeyEvent::PRESS);`
content.html: Just for completeness, you could also set the event type: this->dataPtr->keyEvent.SetType(KeyEvent::PRESS);

content.raw: It looks like the `keyModifiers` variable is always set and used within the scope of the `HandleKey*` functions. Does it need to be a member variable? We could do for example `_e->modifiers() & Qt::ControlModifier` directly.
content.html: It looks like the keyModifiers variable is always set and used within the scope of the HandleKey* functions. Does it need to be a member variable? We could do for example _e->modifiers() & Qt::ControlModifier directly.

content.raw: Should this be getting `_e->text()` instead? I'm not sure why we need the `keyText` variable.
content.html: Should this be getting _e->text() instead? I'm not sure why we need the keyText variable.
